clusters.title: Everest hikers guided to safety after being stranded by blizzard
clusters.neutral_headline: Hundreds of Everest Hikers Rescued After Blizzard

items.title: Everest hikers guided to safety after being stranded by blizzard
items.standfirst: Hundreds of hikers have been guided to safety in Tibet after becoming trapped over the weekend by heavy snowfall.
items.content: Hundreds of hikers have been guided to safety in Tibet after becoming trapped over the weekend by heavy snowfall.

items.title: üèîÔ∏è Hundreds of trekkers escape from blizzard-struck Everest in Tibet
items.standfirst: ‚ùÑÔ∏è Hundreds of trekkers stranded by a blizzard near the eastern face of Mount Everest in Tibet have been guided to safety by rescuers, Chinese state media reported, as unusually heavy snow and rainfall pummelled the Himalayas. üá®üá≥ Outdoor enthusiasts have flocked to China's rugged interior since an eight-day holiday began on October 1, but a sudden blizzard over the weekend caught off guard hundreds of hikers hoping to catch a glimpse of Everest's Kangshung face. ‚õëÔ∏è Some 350 trekkers have reached the small town of Qudang, while more than 200 trekkers still stranded in freezing temperatures are expected to be evacuated by Tuesday.
items.content: ‚ùÑÔ∏è Hundreds of trekkers stranded by a blizzard near the eastern face of Mount Everest in Tibet have been guided to safety by rescuers, Chinese state media reported, as unusually heavy snow and rainfall pummelled the Himalayas. üá®üá≥ Outdoor enthusiasts have flocked to China's rugged interior since an eight-day holiday began on October 1, but a sudden blizzard over the weekend caught off guard hundreds of hikers hoping to catch a glimpse of Everest's Kangshung face. ‚õëÔ∏è Some 350 trekkers have reached the small town of Qudang, while more than 200 trekkers still stranded in freezing temperatures are expected to be evacuated by Tuesday.

items.content: More than 200 people left stranded by a blizzard near the eastern face of Mount Everest are being evacuated, Reuters news agency reports.

clusters.title: Draft White House memo suggests furloughed government workers are not guaranteed pay
clusters.neutral_headline: White House Memo Suggests No Back Pay for Furloughed Workers

items.title: Draft White House memo suggests furloughed government workers are not guaranteed pay
items.standfirst: President Trump was questioned on Tuesday about whether federal workers will receive back pay for salaries lost due to the government shutdown. The questions came after a draft White House memo suggested furloughed federal workers and employees working without pay are not guaranteed compensation. CBS News White House reporter Aaron Navarro has more.
items.content: President Trump was questioned on Tuesday about whether federal workers will receive back pay for salaries lost due to the government shutdown. The questions came after a draft White House memo suggested furloughed federal workers and employees working without pay are not guaranteed compensation. CBS News White House reporter Aaron Navarro has more.

items.title: White House says furloughed federal workers not entitled to back pay amid shutdown
items.standfirst: OMB argues an amendment to a 2019 act would not guarantee furloughed workers post-shutdown payThe White House‚Äôs office of management and budget (OMB) is arguing that federal workers who are furloughed amid the ongoing government shutdown are not entitled to back pay.In a draft memo first obtained by Axios, OMB argued that an amendment to the Government Employee Fair Treatment Act (GEFTA) of 2019 would not guarantee furloughed workers back pay and that said funds must be set aside by Congress. Continue reading...
items.content: OMB argues an amendment to a 2019 act would not guarantee furloughed workers post-shutdown payThe White House‚Äôs office of management and budget (OMB) is arguing that federal workers who are furloughed amid the ongoing government shutdown are not entitled to back pay.In a draft memo first obtained by Axios, OMB argued that an amendment to the Government Employee Fair Treatment Act (GEFTA) of 2019 would not guarantee furloughed workers back pay and that said funds must be set aside by Congress. Continue reading...

items.title: White House floats no back pay for some furloughed federal workers despite 2019 law
items.standfirst: A new draft White House memo suggests a 2019 law signed by President Trump that guarantees that federal employees get paid after a shutdown ends would not apply to furloughed workers.
items.content: A new draft White House memo suggests a 2019 law signed by President Trump that guarantees that federal employees get paid after a shutdown ends would not apply to furloughed workers.(Image credit: Anna Moneymaker)

ai_summary: A draft White House memo suggests furloughed federal workers may not get back pay.

The memo was first obtained by Axios.
The 2019 law was signed by President Trump.
The law guarantees federal employees get paid after a shutdown ends.

items.title: The Nobel Prize for physics is awarded for discoveries in quantum mechanical tunneling
items.standfirst: The Nobel committee said that the laureates' work provides opportunities to develop "the next generation of quantum technology, including quantum cryptography, quantum computers, and quantum sensors."
items.content: The Nobel committee said that the laureates' work provides opportunities to develop "the next generation of quantum technology, including quantum cryptography, quantum computers, and quantum sensors."(Image credit: Christine Olsson)

items.title: Nobel Prize in physics awarded to U.S. trio for discoveries in quantum mechanics
items.standfirst: Three U.S.-based scientists were awarded the Nobel Prize in physics Tuesday for their discoveries in quantum mechanics.
items.content: Three U.S.-based scientists were awarded the Nobel Prize in physics Tuesday for their discoveries in quantum mechanics.

ai_summary: The Nobel Prize in Physics was awarded for discoveries in quantum mechanical tunneling.
The laureates' work provides opportunities for quantum technology development.
This includes quantum cryptography, quantum computers, and quantum sensors.
Three U.S.-based scientists received the Nobel Prize for their work.
The discoveries were in the field of quantum mechanics.
